Ask HN: How to encrypt data in a SQL database?
text:
Hey HN,

I will need to store some sensitive data (API keys, Client Secrets) of my customers in my DB. I was wondering if anyone could help me with these questions.

1. What are the best practices for storing client secrets and API keys in a DB? 2. Should the encryption be handled in the application level (using a library built on top of Node Crypto) or the database level (with pgcrypto)? What are the pros/cons of each option? 3. What are some good encryption libraries in Node.js (I want to avoid rolling my own crypto)? 4. At what frequency should I rotate keys? What are some methods to handle key rotation?

Thanks a lot!

Show HN: IDE Like Terminal
text:
Terminal built with Tauri (Rust+Svelte).

I got this idea of creating a terminal that is more user friendly having autocomplete suggestions. I couldn’t create a suggestions engine that would work for all commands. But I defined a structure (a state machine in src/cli/library/library.ts) that can be used to determine the next suggestions. The good part with this approach is that it is possible to have custom script based suggestions. For example if we write in the terminal “git checkout” and after we press Space, a dropdown will appear with all available branches. The bad part is that it will take some time to add more supported commands in this “library”.

Another feature is that in the bottom bar of the terminal we can have custom script based information. In .manter.json we can define a script that will generate this information. The script will be executed each time the prompt appears.

On the front-end are used web technologies which offer a flexibility to add any feature and style that we want.

Repository: https://github.com/iondodon/manter

Show HN: Terminal with autocomplete suggestion built with Tauri
text:
Terminal built with Tauri (Rust+Svelte).

I got this idea of creating a terminal that is more user friendly having autocomplete suggestions. I couldn’t create a suggestions engine that would work for all commands. But I defined a structure (a state machine in src/cli/library/library.ts) that can be used to determine the next suggestions. The good part with this approach is that it is possible to have custom script based suggestions. For example if we write in the terminal “git checkout” and after we press Space, a dropdown will appear with all available branches. The bad part is that it will take some time to add more supported commands in this “library”.

Another feature is that in the bottom bar of the terminal we can have custom script based information. In .manter.json we can define a script that will generate this information. The script will be executed each time the prompt appears.

On the front-end are used web technologies which offer a flexibility to add any feature and style that we want.

Link to opensource project: https://github.com/iondodon/manter

Ask HN: Does “choose not to identify” hurt your chances when applying online?
text:
If you've been applying for jobs recently you're familiar with the ubiquitous final trivia round of filling in the application form: What's your gender, what's your race, are you a veteran, do you have a disability.

Most of the times, you're given the option to opt-out of providing that information - and I feel like I would like to opt out of regurgitating my stats but I'm curious about what impact that might have on my attractiveness as a candidate.

I've only ever participated in the hiring process at the interview level, not as a hiring manager - does anyone have any insight to share into not just the ideal utility of those questions, but the actual practical implications of a non-answer from an applicant?

title: Physics Is Everywhere (Flying Circus of Physics)
Tell HN: It looks like ChatGPT can read blog posts now
text:
Me > Summarize this blog post: https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases/monetary20230201a.htm

It > The Federal Reserve's press release on February 1st, 2023 announces the results of its latest monetary policy meeting. The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) decided to maintain the target range for the federal funds rate at 0.00-0.25 percent. The FOMC also emphasized that they will continue to support the US economy through the ongoing public health crisis and resultant economic challenges. The Committee noted that the US economy is recovering but at a slower pace than they had previously anticipated. To support the recovery, the FOMC plans to continue purchasing Treasury and agency mortgage-backed securities at the current pace. Additionally, the Committee stated that it will continue to provide support to the US financial system and economy through its lending facilities.
